content.description: Climb on angled holds to the first bolt (crux) and then gain a balancey ledge. Clip the second bolt then climb 20 feet of very fun 5.6 flakes to the 3rd bolt. Take a deep breath and go for the anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts. There is small gear between the 2nd and 3rd bolt, but it is not necessary if you're solid at the grade. There is a rap anchor at the top.
content.location: About 150 feet down and left from the trailhead.

content.description: This is a route with unintuitive moves that starts on jugs and ends in a hand crack.
content.protection: 3 bolts before the crack. Bring a 1" or 2" cam to protect the top before finishing on bolted anchors.
content.location:
It is just right of

Mystery Flake

.

content.description: Look for a chalked up flake. Start up the flake with fingers which trends slightly left and then straight up. The crack then turns into tight hands and ends on a ledge. There are anchors on top of the sport climb next to the crack, but set a good directional if top roping from these anchors so your second doesn't take an unfortunate pendulum.
content.protection: Fingers to hand sized cams and a good selection of wires.
content.location: This is one of the first routes when first approaching the wall from the notch. Look for a chalked up flake.
